item.title: Packed Executables
item.description: There are several indicators that the executable is packed. Here they are (this list will be growing as I encounter new indicators):

item.title: Reverse Engineering iOS Applications 🍏
item.description: During forensic analysis it’s not too rare to run into some suspicious application. In this article I’m going to learn to reverse engineer iOS applications.

item.title: Dynamic Analysis
item.description: This is more about cracking. Cracking lab presents…. . Staring: 🌟 Tools 🧰: OllyDbg as a debugger, Import Reconstructors as an … wait for it ….

item.title: Crackme Algorithm
item.description: Look at the strings fs strings and f in radare2 or rabin -zz Find xrefs for the strings of interest axt @ str.

item.title: Reverse Engineering Android Applications 🤖
item.description: In this article I’m assembling information about debugging applications on Android, then all possible to anti-debugging techniques and how they can be curcumvented (a little spoiler here - almoust always one way 😀) .

item.title: Symbolic and Conrecte Execution
item.description: References [1] Mobile SecGuide [2] Symbolic execution on iOS with R2Frida & ESILSolve [[3]([2] Symbolic execution on iOS)] Concrete execution on iOS with Angr.
